etymologies: Middle English: from Anglo-Latin curtana (spatha) ‘shortened (sword)’, from Old Frenchcortain, the name of the sword belonging to Roland (the point of which was damaged when it was thrust into a block of steel), from cort ‘short’, from Latin curtus ‘cut short’

definitions: the unpointed sword carried in front of English sovereigns at their coronation to represent mercy

examples.text: Curtana is borne in the front rank of the regalia

shortDefinitions: unpointed sword carried in front of English sovereigns at their coronation
